title: Overnight oats with squash, pecans and honey

planning.prep_time: PT15 minutes, plus cooling and overnight soakingM
planning.total_time: PT55 minutes, plus cooling and overnight soakingM

ingredients.item: 500g butternut or golden butternut squash, peeled, deseeded and roughly chopped (about ½ large butternut)
270ml milk (or almond drink), plus extra to serve
2 tbsp maple syrup or honey, plus extra to drizzle

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 200˚C, gas mark 6. Put the squash in a roasting tin, sprinkle over the cinnamon, cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes, until soft. Set aside to cool. Roast the nuts on a tray for 4-6 minutes, until a shade darker. Remove, leave to cool, then chop.

Meanwhile, in a large bowl combine the oats, milk, vanilla, maple syrup or honey plus a pinch of salt. Once the squash is cool, mash with a fork (or whizz in a food processor) until smooth. Stir into the oat mixture, then cover and chill overnight.

The next morning, give the oats a stir; the mixture will be quite thick. If you prefer it thinner, then add a few tablespoons of milk. Divide the oats between 4 bowls (or jars, to transport) then top with the yogurt, pecans and a drizzle of maple syrup or honey.
